metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1782 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The kex_agree_methods function in libssh2 before 1.5.0 allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (crash) or have other unspecified impact via crafted length values in an SSH_MSG_KEXINIT packet. It was discovered that libssh2 mishandled certain input. If libssh2 were used to connect to a malicious or compromised SSH server, the server could cause the client to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1782` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh2-1 - 1.5.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.0-1').
